greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Last filtering prime for n-th prime p: find smallest prime factor of each of the composite numbers between p and next prime; take maximal value.
comment: A000879(n) is the least index i such that a(i) = prime(n). - _Labos Elemer_, May 14 2003
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=2..10000
formula: a(n) = Max_{j=1+prime(n)..prime(n+1)-1} A020639(j) where A020639(j) is the least prime dividing j.
example: For n=9, n-th prime is 23, composites between 23 and next prime are 24 25 26 27 28, smallest prime divisors are 2 5 2 3 2; maximal value is 5, so a(9)=5.
mathematica: mpf/@ Partition[ Prime[Range[2,100]],2,1] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 30 2013 *)
program: f ws = (maximum $ map a020639 us) : f vs where
(PARI) a(n) = {my(p = prime(n), amax = 0); forcomposite(c = p, nextprime(p+1), amax = max(factor(c)[1,1], amax);); amax;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 21 2018
from sympy import prime, nextprime, primefactors
return max(min(primefactors(m)) for m in range(p+1, q))
print([a(n) for n in range(2, 95)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Feb 02 2021
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Feb 05 2000
